snippet: Kurdish officials said the intensified attacks in Kobani had allowed them to regain territory and push the militants back on several fronts.
abstract: United States has sharply increased number of airstrikes against Islamic State militants in besieged city of Kobani, Syria, aided by information provided by Kurdish fighters; Kurdish officials say intensified attacks have allowed them to regain territory and push militants back on several fronts.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Kareem Fahim from Suruc, Turkey. Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Suruc.

lead_paragraph: Kurdish officials said the intensified attacks in Kobani had allowed them to regain territory and push the militants back on several fronts.

headline.main: U.S. Steps Up Strikes on Embattled Syrian Town, Aided by Data From Kurds
headline.print_headline: U.S. Steps Up Strikes on Embattled Town, Aided by Data From Kurds
